title: EastEnders SPOILER: Martin Fowler is caught in ANOTHER brawl
text:
EastEnders' Martin Fowler will be at the centre of another violent brawl on Thursday, after a sinister pick-up with Ben Mitchell's henchman Tubbs spirals out of control.

After weeks of being blackmailed by Ben to keep quiet about wife Stacey attacking Phil Mitchell, things are only going to get worse for Martin as he is tasked with completing a sinister pick-up.

It remains to be seen whether Martin will escape the brawl unscathed, especially as fans begin to wonder if he will ever be free of Ben's plots.

Drama: EastEnders' Martin Fowler will be at the centre of another violent brawl on Thursday, after a sinister pick-up with Ben Mitchell's henchman Tubbs spirals out of control

In the snaps, Martin (played by James Bye) is tasked with embarking on another pick-up under Ben's (Max Bowden) orders, where he is joined by Tubbs.

But when a fight breaks out, Martin is caught in the middle, and it appears he'll be sent flying into a nearby car.

Things have gone from bad to worse for Martin since he returned to Albert Square, after also learning that his daughter Bex tried to take her own life.

Nasty: Martin has been blackmailed for weeks by Ben, and it seems his latest 'job' will turn violent

This is not the first time Martin has been caught up in a brawl in recent days, after he attacked Ben Mitchell in scenes that aired last week.

The fight erupted in The Arches after Ben refuses to let Stacey return to Walford - even though he said he would if Martin stole a car.

Things came to a head on Thursday night's show when Ben (Max Bowden) told Martin (James Bye) to steal the vehicle after his wife's crime.

Volatile: It comes after Martin was involved in a violent clash with Ben on Friday night's show

He had said: 'Let's not forget who's the boss here! Let's not forget who took a wrench to my dad.'

Martin then replied: 'I do this, you give me the wrench and we're done', and Ben agreed.

But on Friday's show Ben went back on his word and refused to give him the wrench, prompting Martin to punch him which sparks the brawl between the men.

Betrayed: The fight erupted in The Arches after Ben refuses to let Stacey return to Walford - even though he said he would if Martin stole a car

The animosity between the two characters dates back to when Stacey (Lacey Turner) hit Phil (Steve McFadden) over the head with a wrench earlier in the summer, prompting him to fall into the pit at his car repair garage.

The brunette's panicked attack came after Phil had begun to overpower Martin during a brawl between the pair.

The brawl was sparked after Phil called Stacey a 'nutjob of a wife'.

It was a twist for many fans who had predicted that Ben would be the one to attack his father after learning he had been cut out of the older man's will.

Tense: The animosity between the two characters dates back to when Stacey hit Phil over the head with a wrench earlier in the summer

Nine lives? Anyone who turned on EastEnders expecting Phil Mitchell to be dead clearly didn’t know him, or it, very well

This is not the first time Phil has suffered a brush with death; back in 1999 he suffered a blood clot after being attacked by his brother Grant amid the infamous Sharon-gate storyline.

He was then left for dead during the infamous Who Shot Phil storyline in 2001, before almost burning to death in Queen Vic amid his addiction from crack cocaine.

Along with being shot on his wedding day and endless car crashes, Phil was told in 2016 he had months to live after heavy drinking led to cirrhosis of the liver.

Told he would need a transplant, a Christmas miracle saw a donor step forward, and Phil went onto cause drama and conflict for another day.
description: EastEnders' Martin Fowler will be at the centre of another violent brawl on Thursday, after a sinister pick-up with Ben Mitchell's henchman Tubbs spirals out of control.
